intro: Leichhardtia variifolia, commonly known as the variable leaf lily, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often in open woodlands or heathlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a variegated appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. It is a perennial herb that produces tall, slender stems with clusters of flowers that bloom in spring.
